page.title: 08Trade
page.content: Dereham, heart of Norfolk, is a busy thriving shopping centre and market town for a wide area with fast growing population. Free parking attracts drivers from surrounding villages, buses link with villages and large towns and cities. Dating back to 7th Century its streets were not built for large vehicles of to-day which cause congestion in servicing local shops. The recent by pass has however eased the traffic problem. There is a wide variety of well stocked shops and businesses, but multiple stores dominate often causing local shops to close. Long established family industrial firms have suffered too in the recent recession, but others have taken over and hopes are high. The market square is busy on Market days when villagers buy, meet friends and catch up with the local news.
